intro: Aegiphila lanata, commonly known as the woolly aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves that give it a fuzzy appearance. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Aegiphila lanata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
